ovdesc.p: The Group Credit Interest Table allows the specification of a calculation method for credit interest for groups of accounts. Account groups are determined automatically on the basis of Customer and Account details such as Residence, Sector, Account Category and Currency. At the time of Account input, reference is made to General Condition and Condition Priority tables. From these a General Condition code is derived for later access to the Group Credit Interest table. (For further information, see the General Condition and Condition Priority tables.)
- Interest can be calculated on a Daily, Average or Minimum balance basis using value dated balances.
- Rates can be fixed or linked to Basic Rates plus or minus a Margin.

- Different rates can be specified for different balance levels and may be linked to the same or different basic rates. The rates may apply to the whole of the balance or to the part between two balance levels.
Where special credit interest conditions apply to a specific account, reference should be made to the ACCOUNT.CREDIT.INT table.

Determines whether the interest calculation will be performed up to the credit balance Level or in Bands (where the interest calculation employed is dependent upon the size of credit balance).

If more than one set of fields CR.BASIC.RATE to CR.LIMIT.AMT are input, this indicates that a different interest rate is applicable depending on the size of the credit balance. CR CALCUL TYPE specifies whether separate calculations are to be made for each Band of the credit balance or one is to be made on the entire balance, dependent on the Level of the balance.
Example:
Assume a credit balance of 15,000 and a Group Credit Interest record which specifies an applicable rate of 10 per cent up to 10,000 and 15 per cent above 10,000.
If Band is specified, 2 calculations will be performed, i.e.
10 per cent on 10,000 15 per cent on 5,000
If Level is specified, 1 calculation will be performed, i.e.
15 per cent on 15,000.

'BAND' or 'LEVEL' or any abbreviation thereof. (Mandatory input if more than one set of fields CR.BASIC.RATE to CR.LIMIT.AMT are specified, otherwise optional. Not allowed if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS contains 'NONE'.)

This field represents the last day number to which the minimum balance should be calculated to. The date is used only in conjunction with the BALANCE.TYPE set to MINIMUM.
If a range of days is set then the interest over the accrue period will be calculated on a month to month basis rather than on the entire accrual period.
For example: If the Start date is set to the 10th and the End date set to 31st, then the calculation for interest will be based on the minimum balance on the account between these days for the month.
A numeric number between 1 and 31.
The last day will not overlap into the next accrue period.

Determines the method by which the Rate specified in corresponding field CR2.BASIC.RATE or CR2.INT.RATE, is adjusted by the Margin specified in corresponding field CR2.MARGIN.RATE. (CR2 fields specify a second interest which may be calculated.)
Fields CR2.BASIC.RATE to CR2.LIMIT.AMT are used to specify rates applicable to different balance limits.

If the Rate specified in CR2.BASIC.RATE or CR2 INT RATE, is to be adjusted by a Margin, this field specifies whether the Margin Rate is to be added to, subtracted from or multiplied by the Basic Rate to arrive at the effective interest rate.
If 'Multiply' is specified the final rate is (100 + M) percent of the Rate from field CR2.BASIC.RATE or CR2.INT.RATE, where M is the Margin Rate percentage from field CR2.MARGIN.RATE.
For examples see field CR.BASIC.RATE.

'ADD', 'SUBTRACT' or 'MULTIPLY', or any abbreviation thereof. Multivalue field associated with fields CR2.BASIC.RATE to CR2.LIMIT.AMT. (Optional input. Only allowed if corresponding field CR2.BASIC.RATE or CR2.INT.RATE, is input.)

1-4 numeric characters. Multivalue field associated with Fields CR.BASIC.RATE to CR.LIMIT.AMT. (Optional input. Not allowed if corresponding CR.INT.RATE, is input or INTEREST.DAY.BASIS contains 'NONE'.) There must be a record in the BASIC.INTEREST table (Ref: General Tables) with a key consisting of this code, the Currency of the Account and an effective date which is less that or equal to the date specified in Field 0, (Record ID). Examples: The rate or rates of interest which will be applied are defined by the following multivalue group of fields: BASIC RATE INT RATE MARGIN OPER MARGIN RATE LIMIT AMOUNT Examples of their use is as follows: 1) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate, only enter the following field: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate. 2) If the interest rate is to be fixed, only enter the following field: INT RATE - the actual rate of interest. 3) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate minus a Margin; enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Base Rate MARGIN OPER - 'SUBTRACT' MARGIN RATE - the Marginal Rate. 4) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate plus a Percentage of the floating Basic Rate; enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - 'MULTIPLY' MARGIN RATE - Percentage to be added 5) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate, minus a Margin up to a limiting amount and a floating Basic Rate, minus a different Margin above that limiting amount, enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - 'SUBTRACT' MARGIN RATE - Rate to be subtracted LIMIT AMOUNT - The limit amount for the above defined rate BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - 'SUBTRACT' MARGIN - Rate to be subtracted.

This field denotes whether the Account should receive any interest for the month, if the account was closed after the specified start date for the MINIMUM balance type.

Setting the field to Yes will allow the Account to receive interest up to the closure date according to the minimum balance criteria, effectively making the closure date the end date for the minimum balance requirements.

Specifies the Minimum Credit Balance, below which interest is not paid.
The amount on which interest is to be calculated (depending on CR2.BALANCE.TYPE) is compared with this field and, if less, no interest is calculated.
For example if the minimum balance to be maintained is USD 1,000.00 then the value in this field should be set at USD 999.99.
This is to maintain consistency with band/level fields where the same logic is used.

Rate field.
Numeric input.
Use only valid in conjunction with CR.BASIC.RATE.
There are 3 options (YES, BLOCK.MARGIN and NO/Blank)
Blank or NO
Indicates that negative rates cannot be input and if a rate becomes negative as a result of the application of a margin the rate will be set to zero
YES
Indicates that negative rates can be input and if the application margin makes the rate more negative
then the more negative rate will be used.
BLOCK.MARGIN
Indicates that negative rates can be used but the following conditions apply
- If the rate is positive and the margin makes the rate negative then the rate will be set to zero
- If the rate is negative and the margin makes the rate more negative then the margin will be ignored and the original negative rate is used
